name: Ginger Murchison
bio: Ginger Murchison is the author of a scrap of linen, a bone (Press 53, 2016). She earned her MFA from Warren Wilson College and helped found Poetry at Tech series at the Georgia Institute of Technology, where she served as associate director and as one of its visiting McEver Chairs in Poetry. She serves as a trustee of The Frost Place, as a member of the conference faculty for the Palm Beach Poetry Festival, and as editor in chief of the Cortland Review. She lives in Fort Myers, Florida.
